title: Hybrid Classroom Learning Operation and Management in the Post-COVID Era

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary education curriculum management experience and basic digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: An environment where in-service secondary school teachers can flexibly participate via personal devices, requiring enhanced competency in designing hybrid classrooms in response to post-pandemic educational changes.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the three core elements (technology integration, interaction strategies, flexible assessment) for effective hybrid learning design.
Learners can propose solutions to five potential problem scenarios when operating online-offline integrated classes in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.
Learners can apply four interaction design principles to consider when developing mobile-based microlearning content.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
